DataElement.preferredName: Patient Gastrointestinal Tract Disease or Disorder Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response indicating whether a patient meets the eligibility criteria regarding gastrointestinal tract diseases or disorders.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Gastrointestinal Tract Disease or Disorder Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._The upper gastrointestinal (GI) tract is comprised of mouth, pharynx, esophagus and stomach while the lower GI tract consists of intestines and anus. The primary function of the GI tract is to ingest, digest, absorb and ultimately excrete food stuff._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Gastrointestinal Tract Disease or Disorder Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: The upper gastrointestinal (GI) tract is comprised of mouth, pharynx, esophagus and stomach while the lower GI tract consists of intestines and anus. The primary function of the GI tract is to ingest, digest, absorb and ultimately excrete food stuff.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: The upper gastrointestinal (GI) tract is comprised of mouth, pharynx, esophagus and stomach while the lower GI tract consists of intestines and anus. The primary function of the GI tract is to ingest, digest, absorb and ultimately excrete food stuff.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have ulcerative
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have ulcerative colitis, inflammatory bowel disease, or a partial or complete small bowel obstruction?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any condition that would modify small bowel absorption of oral medications, including malabsorption or resection of pancreas or upper bowel?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had any of the following within 2 months of registration: active peptic ulcer disease, active inflammatory bowel disease (including ulcerative colitis and Crohn's disease), diverticulitis, cholecystitis, symptomatic cholangitis or appendicitis, or malabsorption syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have gastrointestinal disease limiting the ability to swallow oral medications or absorb oral medications including inflammatory bowel disease; malabsorption syndromes?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have Crohn's disease or complete bowel obstruction?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have Crohn's disease, inflammatory bowel disease, or a partial or complete small bowel obstruction?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have gastrointestinal disease limiting the absorption of AZD9291, such as malabsorption syndromes or inflammatory bowel disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had any of the following within 2 months of registration: active peptic ulcer disease, diverticulitis, cholecystitis, symptomatic cholangitis or appendicitis, or malabsorption syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have clinically significant GI disorders including history of small bowel obstruction unless the obstruction was a surgically treated remote episode?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have disease significantly affecting gastrointestinal function and/or inhibiting small intestine absorption, such as malabsorption syndrome, resection of portions of small bowel larger than 3 feet, or poorly controlled inflammatory bowel disease affecting the small intestine?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of inflammatory bowel disease, including ulcerative colitis and Crohn's Disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have current signs and/or symptoms of bowel obstruction or signs and/or symptoms of bowel obstruction within 3 months prior to starting study drugs?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have refractory nausea and vomiting, chronic gastrointestinal (GI) diseases (e.g., inflammatory bowel disease) or significant bowel resection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient not have active gastrointestinal tract disease, any clinically significant gastrointestinal abnormalities that may alter absorption such as malabsorption syndrome or major resection of the stomach or bowels?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had a history of bowel obstruction within 1 month prior to starting study drugs?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of bowel obstruction within 1 month of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have gastrointestinal disease limiting the ability to swallow oral medications or absorb oral medications including refractory nausea and vomiting, chronic gastrointestinal diseases, inflammatory bowel disease; malabsorption syndromes?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has had any evidence of active or acute diverticulitis, intra-abdominal abscess, and GI obstruction has patient been evaluated for the potential need for additional treatment before coming on study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has had any evidence of active or acute diverticulitis, intra-abdominal abscess and GI obstruction, has patient been evaluated for the potential need for additional treatment before coming on study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active or prior documented inflammatory bowel disease (e.g., Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis), or any other chronic, serious GI condition associated with diarrhea?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has had evidence of active or acute diverticulitis, intra-abdominal abscess, GI bleeding, obstruction, and abdominal carcinomatosis which are known risk factors for bowel perforation have they been evaluated for the potential need for additional treatment before coming on study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active or prior documented inflammatory bowel disease (i.e. ulcerative colitis)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have refractory nausea and vomiting, chronic gastrointestinal diseases or previous significant bowel resection, with clinically significant sequelae that would preclude adequate absorption of AZD6738?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have chronic inflammatory bowel disease and/or bowel obstruction?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have Crohn's disease or ulcerative colitis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF TEXT3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient at an increased risk for gastrointestinal perforations including history of diverticulitis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have evidence of active or acute diverticulitis, intra-abdominal abscess, GI obstruction and abdominal carcinomatosis which are known risk factors for bowel perforation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the have an increased risk for gastrointestinal perforations including history of diverticulitis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF TEXT4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an increased risk for gastrointestinal perforations including history of diverticulitis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have bowel obstruction or any condition precluding oral intake, gastric tube for venting purposes or significant gastrointestinal disease or fistula?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient had a previous diagnosis of immune or inflammatory colitis, or chronic diarrhea greater than 1 month without immune or inflammatory colitis, is it adequately controlled (no diarrhea greater than grade 1 for at least 28 days) with the absence of symptoms related to colonic dysfunction?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 24
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of or active inflammatory bowel disease (e.g., Crohn's disease and ulcerative colitis) or active bowel inflammation (e.g., diverticulitis)?

DataElement.administrativeNotes:
7/21/23 removed special character from AQT_mmt
